name: I Love hue 2
description:
When I applied for the position of 'Head of Semicolons' I was first tasked with building a realtime, multiplayer game using web-technologies and do it within a week.
To be honest, this intimidated me at first. I was used to building software on a very meticulous basis, since I worked at the bank, so naturally, this process takes longer than when you're working on a prototype.
Nevertheless, I quickly got inspired by one of my favorite mobile games; I love hue.
It's a little game which revolves around fixing gradients that cut into tiles and then scrambled, accompanied by a soothing atmosphere and a good soundtrack. I chose to use JavaScript as my stack, since this is my specialty, and decided on Angular for the frontend and a simple Express backend. The 'realtime' part of this project was filled in by using Websockets for communicating player moves along clients and server. So basically 'my' game is a reverse engineered version of this game, compatible with every device that has a JavaScript compatible browser.

This project taught me a lot about myself and what I like about programming and creating, both professionally as well as for fun.

This project is still being maintained.

name: SpaceX Monitor
description: Long story short: I wanted to fool around with PWA's (Progressive Web Apps) and needed a project. This became the SpaceX Monitor; a simple but rather sleek interface, heavily inspired by the SpaceX website itself, that provides an intuitive way of viewing all sorts of information about SpaceX. Be it launches or rocket-components, you can read all about it on the SpaceX Monitor.
